News.Title: Vishwaraj Sugar Posts Q3 FY26 Loss of ₹671.33 Lakhs
News.Summary: Vishwaraj Sugar Industries reported a net loss of ₹671.33 lakhs for Q3 FY26, compared to a profit of ₹62.76 lakhs in Q3 FY25. Revenue declined 16.64% to ₹7,768.35 lakhs.

News.Title: Vishwaraj Sugar Industries Reports Net Loss of Rs 1,436.57 Lakhs in Q2 FY2026
News.Summary: Vishwaraj Sugar Industries Limited posted a net loss of Rs 1,436.57 lakhs for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, compared to a net loss of Rs 2,174.09 lakhs in the same period last year. The company's revenue from operations declined to Rs 5,503.99 lakhs from Rs 9,278.44 lakhs year-on-year, reflecting challenging operational conditions in the sugar industry.

News.Title: Vishwaraj Sugar Industries Completes 30th AGM with All 10 Resolutions Approved by Shareholders
News.Summary: Vishwaraj Sugar Industries Limited held its 30th Annual General Meeting on September 24, 2025, with 154,837 shareholders on record. The meeting saw approval of all 10 resolutions including adoption of audited financial statements as at March 31, 2025, re-appointment of Managing Director Nikhil Katti, and ratification of cost auditors' remuneration for 2025-26. Key appointments approved include Mallikarjun Kadayya Pujar as Whole-Time Director for 3 years from July 16, 2025, Vinita D. Modak as Secretarial Auditor for 5 years (2025-30), and re-appointment of Vishnukumar Kulkarni as Independent Director for second 5-year term from July 17, 2025. The meeting also approved re-appointment of Sneha Nithin Dev as Whole-Time Director for 3 years from October 15, 2025, and office of profit approvals for Lava Katti and Shruti Katti. Total voting participation was 27.95% of outstanding shares, with promoter group holding 63.25 million shares and public non-institutional shareholders holding 143.05 million shares.

News.Title: Vishwaraj Sugar Industries Re-appoints Whole-Time Director, Reports Quarterly Loss of Rs 16.39 Crore
News.Summary: Vishwaraj Sugar Industries Limited re-appointed Mrs. Sneha Nithin Dev as Whole-Time Director for three years effective October 15, 2025, at an annual remuneration of Rs 30 lakhs. The company appointed Mrs. Vinita D Modak as Secretarial Auditor for five years from 2025-26 to 2029-30 and scheduled its 30th Annual General Meeting for September 24, 2025. The company reported quarterly results showing a net loss of Rs 16.39 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, compared to a loss of Rs 17.29 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations increased to Rs 133.06 crore from Rs 101.25 crore year-on-year. The company operates across multiple segments including sugar, co-generation, distillery, and vinegar units, with sugar being the largest revenue contributor at Rs 80.41 crore for the quarter.
